intro: Euonymus euscaphioides, commonly known as the Chinese burning bush, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its attractive, vibrant red foliage in the fall, which makes it a popular ornamental plant. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are elliptic to ovate in shape, with a smooth margin. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by orange-red蒴果 (capsules) that split open to release seeds. Euonymus euscaphioides prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it adaptable to a variety of garden settings.
